discoveredAssets: localhost:5000 - Dalgona Challenges (Flask/Werkzeug) - Port 5000, HTTP only
localhost:5000/static/ - Static CSS and image assets (fonts, stylesheets, images) - Port 5000

targets.objective: Test for query parameter injection vulnerabilities, reflected XSS through query parameters (?page=, ?challenge=, ?id=, ?name=), and any server-side processing of query strings. Verify input validation and output encoding.
targets.rationale: The application accepts query parameters (?page, ?challenge, ?id, ?name) without apparent validation, returning HTTP 200 for all values. This is a potential attack surface for injection and XSS vulnerabilities. The homepage references 'XSS 25' challenge suggesting the application is designed for testing security vulnerabilities.

keyFindings: [MEDIUM] Query parameters accepted without validation - Application accepts arbitrary query parameters (?page=, ?challenge=, ?id=, ?name=) and returns 200 OK regardless of input, indicating potential injection/XSS vulnerability
[MEDIUM] Minimal application surface - Only root endpoint (/) and static assets are accessible; all tested endpoints return 404
[LOW] Static assets accessible without authentication - CSS, images, and fonts in /static/ are publicly accessible
[LOW] Limited HTTP methods - Application only supports GET, HEAD, OPTIONS methods; all other methods (POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, TRACE, CONNECT) return 405 Method Not Allowed
[LOW] No documentation or API endpoints - No swagger.json, openapi.json, robots.txt, or sitemap.xml files found
